summary: This is an email chain from December 23, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and a contractor. The emails discuss the availability of deposition transcripts from the Roberts v. Maxwell civil lawsuit, specifically mentioning that a person (name redacted) was deposed but invoked the Fifth Amendment throughout. The correspondents are trying to locate full transcripts, which are noted to be on a shared drive.

events.title: Email inquiry about Roberts v. Maxwell depositions
events.description: US Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails inquiring about and confirming the existence of deposition transcripts from the Roberts v. Maxwell civil lawsuit, noting one deponent invoked the Fifth Amendment.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) from December 23, 2019.
The emails discuss the Roberts v. Maxwell civil lawsuit and the availability of deposition transcripts from that case.
It is mentioned that a deponent (name redacted) was deposed but invoked the Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination throughout the deposition.
The full deposition transcripts are noted to be stored on a shared 'Epstein share drive' within the office.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative or legal interest in the Roberts v. Maxwell case materials by the U.S. Attorney's Office.
